document_data.name: Gloomwing
document_data.mainbody: '''Gloomwings''' were a type of evil [[fey]] found on the [[Prime Material plane]].
document_data.Description: Gloomwings looked like large, flying [[serpent]]s. They had massive, [[bat]]-like wings which were covered in a fine fur. Their eyes glowed red when they were angry or while feeding. They were strong flyers, capable of carrying up to {{SI|175|lb|k}} while flying at their full speed. They could transport up to {{SI|255|lb|k}} total by air.
document_data.Abilities: Gloomwings had the innate ability to duplicate the effects of the ''[[darkness, 15' radius]]'' spell. They used their [[Darkvision|infravision]] and other excellent senses to locate a target within the globe of magical darkness.
document_data.Combat:
Gloomwings were vicious in combat. It would not hesitate to launch an attack on a what it saw as an easy target. Gloomwings used their innate ''darkness'' ability to ambush a target, as well as to engulf their target in a shroud of darkness.

The bite of a gloomwing delivered a potent and terrible venom. The venom affected targets differently. The venom may cause a target to:
* Become overtaken with ''[[fear]]''.
* Lapse into a deep but temporary coma.
* Become temporarily stunned. 
* Become ''[[confusion|confused]]''.
* Become ''[[feeblemind|feebleminded]]''.
* Temporarily suffer from debilitating and painful convulsions.

Society.Diet: Gloomwings were a carnivores species and ate any creature they defeated in battle. They would also consume carrion if needed.
Society.Habitats: Gloomwings made their lairs among ruins or in caves along cliffs.
Society.Languages: These creatures typically spoke [[Common]], [[Orcish]], and [[Draconic language|Draconic]]. Though they only spoke the latter with evil dragons.
Society.Usages:
Gloomwings were occasionally used as aerial mounts by evil [[cleric]]s as well as messengers and spies by evil dragons.

The wings of a gloomwing were sometimes used as a [[material component]] in spells.{{Cite dragon/147/Variety the Spice of Magic|25}}
